website_summaries.verdict: The expensive Beyerdynamic Dt 1770 Pro is a wonderful headphone pair for musicians and engineers seeking an accurate frequency response in critical listening scenarios.
pros: Superb sonic performance gives clarity and equal representation to the entire frequency range
Ships with two long, removable cablesâone semi-coiled, one straight
cons: Can get a tad uncomfortable over very long listening sessions

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones
customer_reviews.text: Found deciding on which pair of headphones to buy to be very confusing, so many different things to think of and compare. Never bought a pair before so very unsure. Chose these partly because of the make and partly because they had 5 - 40 frequency. Did wonder if a cheaper pair would be just as good but decided to risk it and ago for these. To listen to my various types of music including hip hop. I am a 62 year old woman who dances away to hip hop. Disgraceful. Excellent sound, good treble, though I do use a graphic equalizer too, glad I chose them.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Danone

customer_reviews.title: Easy driving, good for rock music.
customer_reviews.text: I use these with the beyer A2 headphone amp. and find them easy to drive with reasonable sound isolation. They are not as transparent as the beyer T1 semi open back, but they are much cheaper and probably better value. Compared to the T1s, they have a boosted low end, good for rock but not perhaps for monitoring. The ear pads are very comfy but the headband is perhaps a bit small, ear to ear, for my head so that after extended listening they can feel a touch pressing. I've had far less comfortable headphones and am happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent clarity and good build quality
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to imagine headphones sounding better, but people say they can. To my ear, they sound pretty neutral. The bass goes very deep, especially on some tracks, but is super tight. They sound crisp but without being harsh. The level of detail is the first thing I noticed about the sound. I've had and listened to more exciting headphones, that still maintained a good level of detail. Very occasionally, I find something is a bit lost in the mix, that I'm used to hearing. The build quality seems very good by modern standards.
customer_reviews.author: shu48

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones if price is not a factor
customer_reviews.text: These headphones, obviously sound phenomenal. They look premium, they feel premium, they sound premium. With that said, Try the DT 770 first, they sound very similar whilst also being significant;y more comfortable (to me anyways) Sound and comfort are both very subjective things, For me, neither of these things were significantly improved with these headphones when coming from the DT 770 which comes in at a much more reasonable price point. I would give them a 4/5 star rating as it is a fantastic pair of headphones, I just think they are not worth buying for casual use when Beyerdynamic have much more sensible offering around such as the DT 770, 990 and the 880.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Major Defects After A Few Months
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these headphones are fantastic. Better than the DT 770, Fidelio X2's, HD 598C. However I encountered major right earphone defects in two pairs of headphones in less than 4 months. I don't use them that often and I dont mistreat them. My DT 770's have lasted me for over 5 years and are still fine. I simply can't reccomend these until they fix the quality assurance issues with these headphones. Maybe they will be a bit better in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stunning performance
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stunning! Very comfortable despite heavy weight. Sound is near perfect, which shows on poor files immediately. It deals with classical music incredibly well and I have discovered background instruments on pieces I am familiar with. In addition you can change from leather to velours foam, which have different insulation properties, perfect for taking the tube. Amazing, I recommend it with enthusiasm
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Stunning
customer_reviews.text: Superb, the best headphones I have ever used and I have used a few. The quality of the sound delivered to your ears is truly amazing. You hear everything as it is supposed to be heard, the clarity is stunning, not too much bass, in fact these are perfect. Well put together product using top quality materials. I can't recommend these highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: M. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, spacious punchy bass which is crisp
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, spacious punchy bass which is crisp. nice highs and mids. If anything they may lack just a bit of excitement musicality. Otherwise i love them and definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: I was initially disappointed with the top end but z change of interconnect ...
customer_reviews.text: A lovely smooth and detailed sound. I was initially disappointed with the top end but z change of interconnect cable from pre amp to the headphone amplifier proved it wasn't the the headphones fault. (See my review of chord clearway 1m rca lead for the full story)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best headphones I have ever heard. A nice upgrade from DT770's.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stephens

customer_reviews.title: A true pleasure to own and use.
customer_reviews.text: Wow poised powerful performance from these headphones with great clarity. Do not hesitate to buy these beauties.
customer_reviews.author: kiaboy

customer_reviews.title: Only one side works
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work! Straight out of the box left hand side completely silent. Tried both supplied cables but made no difference. Now have to go through the hassle of returning them.
customer_reviews.author: J C.

customer_reviews.title: DT1770 PROs reveal the parts of recordings other headphones cannot reach
customer_reviews.text: I have owned may excellent sets of headphones (Grado, Beyerdynamic, Sennheiser etc) but the new DT-1770 PROs are a complete revelation "revealing the parts of recordings other headphones cannot reach". Just listen to Quincy Jones' production on Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough from Off The Wall. You will have to listen to you entire music collection again.... (On the move they work beautifully with an Oppo-HA-2)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Superb! German made,family owned company since pre war era. Former AKG buyer,never more AKG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as fast or detailed as the DT48s but more comfortable to wear and easier to listen to far prolonged ...
customer_reviews.text: Brought those to replace a pair of DT48. Not as fast or detailed as the DT48s but more comfortable to wear and easier to listen to far prolonged periods.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Buy Sennheiser HD25 instead.
customer_reviews.text: The audio reproduction is not £300 more than a pair of Sennheiser HD25, which produce a more natural sound. There is far too much treble present. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Mr P.

customer_reviews.title: Rattling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Up until yesterday, these were the best headphone I've ever owned. The sound was incredible and definitely transformed my music productions. However, that only lasted a few months. Now there is a strong rattle that I can't get rid of in my left side headphone. This is pretty frustrating given the fact these are $600.00. Update: Contacted a company listed on their website and they will be fixing this for free under a warranty I didn’t have to purchase. All I have to pay for is shipping there.
customer_reviews.author: Willie D

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but watch for QC issues
customer_reviews.text: I love these and would not trade them for other pairs at all. Get these if you want well-rounded, well-built headphones. I would definitely recommend a bit of EQ'ing. The leatherette pads are far better, if a little warm. They do need some burn-in, but do perform well out of the box. There's so much structure and texture that comes out to the same songs I've heard countless times now that I'm still going through my entire library over again. These are the real deal. When ordering I would definitely watch out to ensure you're getting a new box - I had to send back the first one sent, but Amazon shipped me a new box promptly and without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Karan Shah

customer_reviews.title: Highly-end cans at a high-end price.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is what you would expect from cans in this price range - It's fantastic. My gripe is the lack of padding on the headrest. These cans are a bit heavy and the lack of headrest padding can cause discomfort over long sessions. I would highly recommend adding additional padding. Other than that. Easily the best set of cans I've ever owned. That said, I'd still recommend going with the 770's
customer_reviews.author: JuHsTaN

customer_reviews.title: Incredible closed cans!
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand the middling reviews. These cans are FUN. Incredible instrument separation for closed design. Bass is clean, resonant, but not overpowering by any means. High end is the standout with guitars and strings sounding glorious. Only downside for some, but not for me, is the vocals/mids are a little back in the mix on some tracks. I actually prefer this because I can now hear the music surrounding the vocalist. Like hearing old songs for the first time again. My review is based on listening for about 2 months. Most music streamed lossless through tidal into a chord mojo.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: One of the best if not the best closed-back headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I was using the Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro 80 Ohm, DT 990 Pro 250 Ohm, and the Sennheiser HD 6XX. Then, I bought these headphones and that is all I am using right now. However, I purchased two before that had issues but the replacement is working perfectly fine. I also got it from an authorized seller in case I have to file a warranty claim and was on sale for an amazing price of $414! Sound quality, in my humble opinion, is definitely an upgrade from the DT 770 especially in the mids and vocals. Bass is excellent. It is a really great sounding closed-back headphones that easily deserves 5-stars.

customer_reviews.title: I had to return two before I got a good one
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered had a scuff on it. Also the carrying case was pretty badly damaged. The second set seriously had some audio issues I noticed the second I put them on. Everything sounded muffled. The third set is everything I ever hoped it could be, so maybe I'm just having an unlucky streak? Otherwise, it's an incredible headphone. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barenblat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing closed back headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Built like a tank! All of the detail and attack you can handle. Punchy tight detailed bass. Huge soundstage for closed back. Precise imaging. My previous headphones were he4xx and m40x, and I dont miss them at all
customer_reviews.author: joshua kennedy

customer_reviews.title: They sound really good, defective cable
customer_reviews.text: They're not as comfortable as my HD 558s considering their weight and clamping pressure but they do sound really good with a FiiO K5 Pro. They sound surprisingly open for closed backs. The pleather pads are definitely better than the stock velour ones. However, I had a problem with the "detachable" coiled XLR cable which was stuck and took about an hour of fiddling and pulling to finally get it to release. The straight cable had no such issue. I hope I can get the cable replaced.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the very best headphones one can buy.
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the very best headphones one can buy. LOVE LOVE LOVE the accurate reproduction of these headphones. This coming from a retired audiophile who was in the business for 15 years. Also to note this is the manufacture of McIntosh Labs $2,000 headphone with identical specs but a couple minor cosmetic differences including the cables all for 1/4 of the McIntosh's $2,000 price tag. Yes these don't come with the cool metal McIntosh stands but many similar stands available online. I HIGHLY recommend these headphones and the McIntosh MHA100 headphone amp to run them. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right channel dead after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Had these for just over a month. Right channel just died. 2 different amps and 2 different cables confirms that it's the headphones that is the problem. I'm not happy. Definitely will not be buying this brand again. Funny how just after the 30 return period for Amazon is up this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a steal for this price. Honestly they sound as good as a pair of $1600 headphones that I had been auditioning. And the low end is even better. The image is nice and wide, and they are quite comfortable as well. Really impressed with the build quality too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand all the fuss about this particular headphone. The highs are so sharp that it makes my ears ringing. I listened to it on both my Apogee symphony MK II and a Questyle CMA800i, just not my kind of sound I guess.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wrangler

customer_reviews.title: Kickass
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of LCD-X as well, and these just have something unique and aggressive that has me coming back to them still. I Love em'.
customer_reviews.author: Audio guy, dude?

customer_reviews.title: Right channel dead after a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: Right channel got uselessly quiet three days after my return period ended. I guess I have to go through their warranty page now. Otherwise thought they were really great up until now!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Premium product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this headphone to use exclusively for mixing and monitoring. Feels like a premium product, also feels a little heavy on the head but you soon forget you’re wearing them. Have just recently used them so I think they’ll open up over time.
customer_reviews.author: beniospit

customer_reviews.title: Quality is just not what you expect for $485
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for my third replacement after less than 7 months of owning. They seems to break in the small cable that goes between the driver and the connector board in the cups. My DT-770 survived for 10 years so it's disheartening to see this drop in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Bengtson

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not worth the doe
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but they truly dont sound as if they cost as much as they sound
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Noseley

customer_reviews.title: 10 Star
customer_reviews.text: Nice detail, punchy base . nice sound isolation. build quality is top notch . better than all closed back headphones at this price range
customer_reviews.author: Mojtaba

customer_reviews.title: Right side channel dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Right side channel dead after 3 months. Quite disappointing with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A worthy successor to the DT 770
customer_reviews.text: I already own the "holy trinity" of Beyerdynamic: the 770 pro32, the 880 premium250, and the 990 pro250. Curious about the 1770 pro, I decided to try it. This is definitely the worthy successor to the 770. Well built, in Beyerdynamic tradition, with a DETACHABLE mini XLR cable (woo-hoo!), and a very sturdy storage box. Sound is outstanding, with great bass and treble extension and no sibilance or peakiness. I am not an audiophile, but I know a great headphone when I hear it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: calvin j.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones, you can hear things you never heard before in cheaper brands, even compared to my DT880 PRO this is night and day. As with any HiFi system, if the sound is bad, it will only amplify the bad sound, but if you have HiFi recordings, you will be part of the music.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Beyerdynamic DT 1770 PRO 250 ohm
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to my Ibasso D6 Fur-De-Lance Headphone AMP/DAC and let it burn in. First thoughts: Similar sound to my Beyerdynamic DT-770 PRO 250 ohm. Base is more controlled, the highs and mids are clearer. Will give a more in depth review after a few weeks of listening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing, but I bought two from Amazon Warehouse and ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing, but I bought two from Amazon Warehouse and both had driver rattling issues on the right side. Don't buy this headphone unless you have a warranty with Beyerdynamic, and even then, it's going to be a pain to send it in for service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Like the dt770 Went to Grad School
customer_reviews.text: I'll make this short: This headphone sounds like a more refined version of the dt 770. It has better extension both in terms of bass and treble, with a more forward midrange. It's a very smooth headphone but still has impact. It looks and feels very high end, comes with a great case, two sets of earpads, and two cables. If you prefer a more up-front sound, you can easily mod them by removing a piece of felt covering the drivers. If you like a more laid back signature, do nothing. Either way, it sounds fantastic out of the box. Both beyerdynamic fans and those new to the company will appreciate this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: James Sherer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good upgrade with some cosmetic perks and more solid build
customer_reviews.text: I have used Beyer DT 770 Pro headphone for many years. This is a good upgrade with some cosmetic perks and more solid build. Sonically, they are very close, with a similar EQ curve. And this has slightly more clarity in the 200 hz area. I ultimately decided the price difference was not worth it. But I can recommend for those who like the ear cup options, removable cable, and the general EQ (which is bass strong, and treble strong).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As reported elsewhere – these have some quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: Would be an amazing pair of headphones were it not for the fact that one driver plays louder than the other. Specifically, it sounds like the bass is overwhelmingly coming from the left driver. It looks like others here have had similar issues. And as indicated in those reviews, it’s a shame because these headphones are stellar in every other way. Another review said they are like the DT770s, but with much more defined bass and a more open sound. That’s exactly how I would describe them. I have had nothing but good experiences in the past with Beyerdynamic products, so I am hopeful that they will remedy the issues with the DT1770s.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M. Birkland

customer_reviews.title: Great specs and recommendations, but mine was NOT inspected at the factory before being shipped.
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours reading reviews, manufacturer's specs and watching You Tube reviews of headphones. This headphone is supposed to have a balance between very even, uncolored response with just a touch of color to make it a pleasure to hear with. It is capable both of being a premium studio recording and mixing headphone, plus you can hear it plugged into almost any sound source (although it would probably be best with a headphone amp.) So why the low star? The factory overlooked inspecting it's product. Really?......a $600 dollar headphone is not inspected before shipping? One side simply did not work!!!!!! Maybe it was a lemon, but I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for 2 days, then terrible distortion.
customer_reviews.text: Having the same issue as the others. These were the best closed headphones I had ever used but I am starting to get distortion in the right driver that is making them unusable. Not sure what I need to do to get this taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Hedeman

customer_reviews.title: Shrill highs.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific bass. Clear sounding. Ice pick to the ears on treble. Otherwise fantastic headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Elnrik

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control?  Two strikes beyer.
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound, mids are smooth and slightly recessed, bass is plentiful and tight, and highs have good extension. The only problem is that I am starting to question Beyerdynamic's quality control. I recently had to send back a pair of Beyer T1, generation 2 headphones because of rattling in the earcup and eventually one of the drivers went completely dead. Now, the right driver in my DT1770 is distorting heavily, especially on bass notes. I only hope that Beyer will stand by their product and correct things as I really do like the sound signature of these.
customer_reviews.author: JDUB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cans. But needs a car battery of power
customer_reviews.text: Perfect non portable upgrade for the 770s. Better build quality, much better sound. But requires a good amp. The A200 beyerdynamics portable won't cut it. I'd recommend an array of car batteries or space lasers.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It has the potential to be one of the best closed headphones
customer_reviews.text: It has the potential to be one of the best closed headphones. However my pair has a heavy driver mismatch: the right driver is noticeably quieter at some frequencies that the left one. And service centers don't have parts yet, it being a new product. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heorhi Zhyhalko

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy, and they squeeze your head
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy, and they squeeze your head. I don't know how people say these things are comfortable to wear but they are not. The bass sounds good but it's fatiguing, beyerdynamic is known for making very warm headphones so I am not going to knock em on this too hard on that. Mids and highs are perfect. If it wasn't for the comfort issues I would have kept them but ultimately returned them and got the Shure 1540's and am very happy with those.
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great set of cans!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of cans. I spent about 100+ hours listening on these so far after breaking them in for 2 days straight and they sound wonderful. Much lighter than they look. Solid construction. Awesome removable cable and it comes with both coiled and straight cables. The sound stage is nice and open. The low end is fairly tight and responsive. I have not run into any of the issues that others seem to have gotten.
customer_reviews.author: RobK

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC - Mediocre cans
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control, I had a pair that developed a rattle on the right side. It also didn't have as much bass as I expected from a beyedynamic product and it was powered by a Violectric V100 amp. Overall disappointed with this product and could never recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: GLD3

customer_reviews.title: QC concerns
customer_reviews.text: My brother and I each ordered a pair of these. His are amazing and mine have an unacceptable dip from about 800Hz to about 4k. I had to return my pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow are these overrated. Powering them using a Schiit Fulla 3 and playing Flac for a reference source they just sound OKAY, they do distort quite bad around 95db if you like loud listening when trying to analyse a track. Worst part is the pressure on your lower jaw, wow that is bad.. I cant use these for more than 30 mins without needing a break. In the current market and after trying around 20 pairs of studio headphones i honestly don't know what to recommend however for reference i found that the HyperX Cloud Alpha with dekoni pads sounded around the same as these without the pressure and soundstage.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is awesome, recently re instated my old top drawer Turntable and re played some original old vinyl, classical and super smooth Johnny Mathis. Wow, these headphones do the job. Crystal clear! Expensive, but... You gets what you pay for. So true.
customer_reviews.author: Imcar

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones
customer_reviews.text: The product is great! You'll never hear the music the way you've heard it before. One thing though.. If you have long hair you might loose a few hears if you're djing with these. Maybe the finishing could be done a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Visnja

product_meta.title: beyerdynamic DT 1770 Pro Studio Headphone
product_meta.description: As the first professional studio reference headphones with Tesla 2.0 technology, the DT 1770 PRO has already made its mark in the company's history. The DT 1770 PRO has won over sound engineers and studio users with its impressive sound quality and workmanship. Brilliant highs and a warm bass provide a perfect sound profile that is second to none. A new standard for monitoring, mixing, mastering and recording – precise and powerful.
feature_bullets: Closed studio reference headphones for mixing, mastering, monitoring and recording, Made in Germany
250 ohms, 45 mm dynamic Tesla neodymium drivers
Single sided, detachable cable with mini-XLR connectors.Nominal sound pressure level:102 dBSPL (1mW/500Hz)
Soft, replaceable ear pads and headband for long studio sessions
Delivery contents: 2 ear pads (velour and leathrette), 2 cables (coiled and straight, 3m), Premium carrying case.Headphone frequency response:5-40,000 Hz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars239 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
